titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Wel-Met Camps Supervisory Manuals TAM.380
titlestmt.author: Tamiment staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-12-11 10:31:25 -0500.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Fay Itzkowitz, date uknown. The accession number associated with this gift is 2006.067.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Wel-Met Camps, which had divisions in Narrowsburg, Barryville and Silver Lake in Sullivan County, was founded as the Metropolitan Jewish Centers Camp Association in May 1935, and the name may have stood for Welfare Metropolitan. The camp association merged with Goddard-Riverside Community Center, and the camps began to be phased out in the 1970's. Goddard-Riverside, after changing the format, stopped its Wel-Met camping altogether in 1997. A separate Camp Welmet is run in Putnam County by the Mosholu Montefiore Community Center in the Bronx.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Wel-Met Camps Supervisory Manual; TAM 380; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two supervisory manuals from the Wel-Met Camps, Narrowsburg, NY Division. The manuals contain information about the camp program, responsibilities of counselors, and overall goals of the camp.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive has no information about copyright ownership for this collection and is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from it. Materials in this collection, which were created in 1959, are expected to enter the public domain in 2079.
